content.description: Fun movement, crux at the second bolt, finishes on mega jug
content.location: Left most route on the wall

content.description: Climb 10 feet to a big ledge, fun movement through the corner to big holds and good feet the rest of the way
content.location: The leftmost route on the upper ledge on the right side of the crag. Start either from the ledge or down below.

content.description: I think there is a short route ending about half way up the wall. It'd probably fine.
content.location: Short route to the right of "Dry Bones" Which is probably the first route you come to at the head of the approach trail.

content.description: More good moderate rock Climbs right of the hueco and mantles onto the great hangout  ledge up top.
content.location: First route on the short section of cliff at the Grave Yard

content.description: Start on fun face climbing on smaller holds with good feet.  After that few long pulls leads to chains most easily clipped from the jug directly above them.
content.location: This route begins from the next little ledge on the (climber's) right side of the cliff.   Walk up the little approach out right and then walk back across the little belay ledge to the first route on the left side of the ledge.

content.description: Begin on fun easy terrain leading up to the hangout ledge.  From there climb a bit of a chossy face to a fun exit crux to gain a stance for the anchors.
content.location: First tall route climbers right of the short wall.  Starts just right of a large tree at cliff base

content.description: Climb fun and easy rock to a tricky press moved coming out of the second bolt.  More easy climbing leads to chains.
content.location: Only two bolt route on the left side of the short face at the Grave Yard.

content.description: Good Moderate climbing up to anchors before the ledge.  Not a "gimme" for the grade, but protected well for new leaders
content.location: The middle route on the short section of cliff at The Grave Yard.  Climbs left of the hueco feature about 10 feet up.

content.description: The Graveyard is a small area of concentrated moderates mostly in the 5.8-5.9 range.  Most of the routes are shorter but provide a great place to bring new climbers or those seeking to try their first leading experience.  Rock is decent quality, thought still a little breakable in places.  Its stays dry in light rain.
